question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
Set the following change of variable

\[\begin{aligned} u = \sqrt{x}\end{aligned}\]

then we have

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle{ x = u^2 }\end{aligned}\]

and so

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle{ dx = 2u \, du }.\end{aligned}\]

Making this substitution in the integral gives

\[\begin{aligned} \int \frac{\sqrt{x}}{x-1} dx = \int \frac{u}{u^2 - 1} \, 2u \, du = 2\int \frac{u^2}{u^2 - 1} du.\end{aligned}\]

Now we use the method of partial fractions. We have

\[\begin{aligned} \int \frac{\sqrt{x}}{x-1} dx &=2 \int \frac{u^2}{u^2 - 1} du \\ &= 2 \int \frac{u^2 - 1 + 1}{u^2 - 1} du \\ &= 2\int \left( 1 + \frac{1}{u^2 - 1} \right) du \\ &= 2u + \int \frac{2}{u^2 - 1} du \\ &= u + \int \frac{2}{(u - 1)(u+1)} du.\end{aligned}\]

We want to find numbers \(A\) and \(B\) such that

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{2}{(u - 1)(u+1)} = \frac{A}{u-1} + \frac{B}{u+1}.\end{aligned}\]

Multiplying both sides by \((u-1)(u+1)\) yields

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 2 = Au + A + Bu - B.\end{aligned}\]

Equating coefficients of powers of \(u\) on both sides gives

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{cases} 0 = A + B\\ 2 = A - B \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

From the first of these equations we see that \(A = - B\). So the second equation becomes

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 2 = 2A.\end{aligned}\]

Hence \(A = 1\) and \(B = -A = -1\). Therefore, we have

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{2}{(u - 1)(u+1)} = \frac{1}{u-1} - \frac{1}{u+1}.\end{aligned}\]

Using this to rewrite the last integral above, we find

\[\begin{aligned} \int \frac{\sqrt{x}}{x-1} dx &= 2u + \int \frac{2}{(u - 1)(u+1)} du \\ &= 2u + \int \frac{1}{u-1} du - \int \frac{1}{u+1} du \\ &= 2u + \ln|u-1| - \ln|u+1| + C \\ &= 2\sqrt{x} + \ln|\sqrt{x}-1| - \ln|\sqrt{x}+1| + C.\end{aligned}\]
